headline: Pesto Pasta with Chicken
description: Easy chicken pesto pasta recipe made with sautéed garlic chicken tossed with bow tie pasta, sun-dried tomatoes, and pesto sauce, ready in 30 minutes.

video.description: A simple chicken pasta with pesto and sun-dried tomatoes.
video.name: Pesto Pasta with Chicken

name: Pesto Pasta with Chicken
recipeIngredient: 2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
0.33333334326744 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, drained and cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic until tender, then stir in chicken and season with red pepper flakes. Cook until chicken is golden and cooked through.
Combine pasta, chicken, pesto, and sun-dried tomatoes in a large bowl; toss to coat evenly.

review.reviewBody: Yummy and near perfect! I tried this with macaroni and I do feel it would be improved with either penne, farfalle, or possibly shells. The only edit I may suggest would be adding less pesto. It'd make this lighter and it really doesn't need as much as it calls for, unless you're a real big pesto lover. To me personally, it was bordering on too much at 1/3 cup.
Seasoned chicken with seasoning salt instead of red pepper flakes and used whole container of cherry tomatoes instead of sundried.
This makes a lot, so great for leftovers. Next time I would add more pesto and extra red pepper flakes to spice it up.

I didn't really like this but my husband did. This did make a lot, at least 8 servings. For the leftovers, I added a jar of Bertolli pesto alfredo sauce, some grated Parmesan and the rest of the jar of sun-dried tomatoes. I liked it better this way but not enough to make again.
Yum. I used what I had, including one 12.5 can chicken, 2 cups (dry) bow tie pasta, fresh tomato and pine nuts on top. Made my own pesto from 3/4 cup basil.
Great! Used blistered tomatoes instead, and scape pesto. Tasted amazing
It was good,,however I found it to be a little dry. I added some chicken broth and it worked fine for my taste.
It is very oily. Not sure I like the sun-dried tomatoes.
Good weeknight recipe but I’ll boost the flavors next time.
We really like this recipe, but I don't understandhow it is 8 servings.
Making this for the second time. It’s easy snd delicious. Perfect summer meal because you don’t have to heat up the kitchen!!
Glad the pesto isn’t cooked in this recipe. I didn’t use Tomatoes, but I added broccoli

my husband loved it because it wasn't salty! I cooked the whole pound of pasta but didn't use all the noodles, probably because I didn't have quite a half cup of pesto. good recipe to use if you have leftover pesto and sundried tomatoes. I seasoned the chicken with the gambit of Italian spices. we had it with some Texas toast. was going to make a salad with it but didn't really need to. super simple recipe.
Delicious and easy! I didn't have sun-dried tomatoes, so I added spinach and diced zucchini. I will try this with the tomatoes. Yummy!
Outstanding! Don’t change a thing. I will make this again and again. Thank you, Kristin.
It is really good but the pesto sausage seem to need something more (to be a little thicker). Other than that the family loved the recipe and it is fast and easy to make.
This was good, hubby loved it. I thought it was a bit too dry for me, next time I may add a little pasta water to thin it out a bit.

It's a nice combination of flavors but the recipe fails to mention that the chicken should be seasoned before it is cooked. I think a lot of the negative reviews are from people that lack the knowledge that seasoning is up to the person cooking the dish and because they don't know, it should be mentioned. Homemade pesto is pretty much a must unless you have found something approaching a decent pesto in a jar.
Upped the garlic pesto and red pepper in it.

This was a big hit! I followed the recipe, with only a few exceptions:
- I used more Pesto than it called for... that was a preference thing. I also think it will depend on how oily the pesto you use is.
- I added shredded parm into the mix, so it soaked up the extra oil and it kept it from getting soupy.
- I then put a layer of shaved parm on top with a sprinkle of toasted pine nuts!

Delish! Definitely putting this in rotation!
Extremely easy and delicious make your own pesto it’ll be worth it.
Delicious recipe! Cook as-is, and add a little minced Parmesan cheese for great flavor!

I think I would go with a little less chicken. In addition, I guess it is depending on what you find for sun-dried tomatoes, I would not drain the tomatoes. It's likely I will make it again with some minor adjustments.
Very quick and easy. Like others I used the oil from the tomato's and more pesto.

The whole family loved it!! (That never happens in our house.)

I used RAO's basil pesto sauce.

I used homemade pesto sauce and tri-coloured bowties . I also added some chopped up pieces of asparagus and a handful of cherry tomatoes along with the garlic. Followed others advice and added toasted pine nuts, fresh basil and parmesan cheese before serving. It all looked very colourful and tasted fantastic! Even my picky husband really enjoyed it!

I don't care for pasta too much but I was looking for something different. This recipe is fast to make and delicious. I would recommend the homemade pesto as it is a simple recipe, I used almonds instead of the pine nuts for the homemade pesto. I liked the bow tie pasta , The flavors in the entire meal were just perfect together. Tasted Like a restaurant meal! Can't wait to have the leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Thanks Kristen for the recipe.

Made this today it could do without the garlic since there is so much garlic taste in the pesto already I definitely agree with adding freshly grated hard Parmesan cheese. Are used my own sun-dried tomatoes from my garden that were soaking in basil garlic and oil and it went so well with this dish I omitted the chicken and served it cold as a salad. It was great. ???
Fantastic!! Had to add walnuts because I didnt have pecans but very tasty!
Absolutely delicious exactly as described.

I love how easy this recipe is. I made it to the T. The only thing I’d change is to add more slivers of sun dried tomatoes. Perhaps doubling it. Also, I’d add fresh chopped basil from the garden. These changes will be a game changer. Thanks for this simple base recipe!!

Followed the recipe exactly. Very simple yet tasty dish! This is one of those recipes that is what you make of it - depending on the type of sauce you use and how well you cook your chicken. Will definitely make it again, but I may try to add an additional vegetable to spruce it up a bit.

Just finished making this, real simple. I add mushrooms with garlic, I toasted pine nuts and added fresh basil and this dish came out awesome. I used Costco Sonoma gourmet kale pesto with white cheddar for the sauce.

This recipe is truly awesome!! I made it at the last minute, rather on a whim, and so used what I had on hand. Instead of bow tie pasta, I used angel hair, and I subbed fresh tomatoes for the sun-dried. So easy and quick to make, and turned out ahh-making!!
easy and delicious
Yum

I could only find pesto with sun dried tomatoes. Because of COVID-19 we only go to one store per week. I made the recipe as written but just added a bit extra of the red pesto we found. My husband wanted peas on the side and added it to his pasta. Not a bad addition. My family loved it. Easy to make and extra for leftovers. Personally I would love the recipe with the pesto and sun dried tomatoes separately. I would love bites of their sweet flavor. This was an extremely easy recipe to make. My husband asked for me to make again. It’s a keeper

instead of uncooked chicken, i simply used canned chicken breast chunks. i believe it makes a lot more coherent sauce with pesto and coats the pasta a lot better, not to mention it is way easier - it breaks down after sautéed with onion. i also used the herbal mix i buy in italy (we live in italy part of the year) for aglio, olio e peperoncino. key is to add pasta water to the mix. this is now one of our favorite dishes. it tasted even better the next day!
excellent taste. I loved it

We liked this recipe, but as it is written, way too much pasta vs sauce. I had to add another 1/3 cup pesto just to get a slight coating of sauce on all of the pasta & chicken. I also added seasoning to my chicken before cooking; pepper, salt, garlic powder, basil. A generous sprinkle of parm cheese at the end is a must.

This recipe has a lot of good ideas, but the execution is a little lacking. For one, I halved the amount of pasta and I still thought the recipe was a little on the bland side. Adding some spices (salt,pepper,oregano) to the chicken before and/or while cooking makes a big difference. Also, the recipe calls for cooking the garlic and then cooking the chicken with the garlic still in the pan. In my opinion, that will lead directly to overcooked garlic. Cooking the chicken and then the garlic leads to a much tastier dish.
Added some cooked broccoli to the mix. I also mixed the ingredients at the end of the recipe in the skillet all together and sautéed it a bit. It was great!

Such a simple and delicious recipe!! I used oil from the tomatoes to cook the chicken, a generous seasoning of red pepper flakes (they add the perfect spice but it’s not overpowering at all) and a whole jar of Classico pesto (218ml) and we loved it! I do think the recipe is better is better with more pesto than called for, however it does state to adjust to your liking so it worked out perfectly with the jar size I bought-I used the called for amount of sun dried tomatoes because I’m not a huge fan of them but they’re easy to eat around my husband loved them in this dish! You could use more or less to taste. We served with some fresh grated Parmesan cheese on top and loved it! I think the type of pesto you use will greatly influence the flavour of this dish, and I’m sure it’s even better with fresh, but for a quick and easy weekday meal we enjoyed it with Classico basil pesto, and it didn’t turn out oily like some other reviewers found. Will be a regular recipe in our house!
very easy and super tasty! topped with feta and extra basil leafs as a garnish made it look and taste top notch
Used homemade pesto I had on hand and only had linguine for pasta. This was absolutely delicious!

DELICIOUS!! We had bought some fresh pesto from a farmers market and were looking for a new recipe to try. Stumbled upon this one & will certainly be making it again. I followed the recipe as noted, with one exception, added diced red onion to the chicken/garlic mixture. For serving, topped with fresh parm & basil. Leftovers are just as good, too!
I LOVE this recipe. This is our go-to and my daughter's favorite meal. She loves it and so do we!

This is a super delicious and easy dish. Like others, I made a few minor adjustments: I sautéed the boneless chicken breasts whole before cutting it up which made them pjuicy. I added chopped yellow onion and garlic to the pan with the red pepper flakes for a couple minutes before I added the chicken to sauté. I sprinkled the chicken with Italian seasoning, salt and pepper. After the chicken breasts were cooked through, I removed them to a plate and tented. Then I added asparagus (cut in 3 piieces), a few tablespoons of sun dried tomato bruschetta (so they were already chopped up) to the onion garlic mixture, sautéed that all together and added a bit more red pepper flakes. When the asparagus was al dente, I removed the pan from the heat. I cut up the chicken and mixed everything (including accumulated juice from chicken) with the pasta and homemade pesto (used an easy NYT pesto recipe). Added fresh parm, salt and pepper and voila! A fine restaurant quality dinner. Will make again and again!
Delicious! Entire family loved it.
Very good and easy. I already had made some pesto and was looking for a recipe to use it in.
Delicious!! Added spinach for a little something extra, turned out amazing!!

This is a nice easy weeknight meal. We happened to have some prepared basil pesto. It was very tasty; I highly recommend. I'll definitely make this again and add some artichokes or asparagus or some other veggie to make a complete meal.

This recipe was good and quick. My family doesn't really care for sun-dried tomatoes so the suggestion was made to replace those with mushrooms. Maybe next time I'll change the chicken for sausage or even shrimp. Lots of great ways to make this recipe for your own tastes.
Very good
Everyone loved this recipe — from 8 years old to 71 years old. I am saving this recipe.
Didn't make any changes, was really good, everyone liked it. Will make it again.

Since it's hard to truly evaluate a recipe if you've changed it, I made the recipe as is. It's got a good flavor & is quick to put together--great for a weeknight meal. My granddaughters (5&7) both liked it really well. I will make the dish again, but will use more red pepper flakes (w/o the grandkids) and probably drizzle EVOO and parmesan over the dish before serving. Good, easy, quick dish with good flavor.
This was super easy, super delicious! I used shrimp instead of chicken. Sautéed shrimp in oil from tomatoes. Husband loved it. Even my very picky mother-in-law had seconds.
Fantastic!
This turned out amazing!!!!!
I didn’t have bow ties so I used shells not a fan of sun dried tomatoes so I didn’t use them. I just wanted something quick and simple and this was perfect
I loved this, easy to make and tasted just like the ones I had growing up. Made it exactly like the recipe.
Tasty and super easy!
So easy to prepare and tastes good!

Very good and quick. I didn't have sun dried tomatoes, so made it without, and added more garlic to suit my taste. I served it with some garlic bread and side salad. I will definitely be making this again.
it probably would have tasted better if I was home to help my husband with it. But he cooked so I cant complain, will try again.
Easy, cheap, and delicious! My sister even made it and she has a household of 5 people and still super affordable and her kids love it!
So fast and easy.
Found this recipe last week and was dying to make it. I was not disappointed. super easy to make and even better to eat. This is going in the regular dinner rotation.

Quick, easy to make and so delicious! I substituted fresh cherry tomatoes for the sun dried tomatoes...chopped them in half and tossed in with chicken, olive oil and garlic mix when chicken was just about cooked. I also garnished the dish with fresh shredded parmesan cheese before serving. Soooo good.
Make it often
We loved this dish! I added asparagus and bacon to this recipe. Everyone went for seconds and leftovers were nonexistent. Thank you! A new family favourite!
I doubled the recipe, my husband licked the bowl clean. Left overs were better than fresh!

Absolutely delish!! & it's quick and easy to make!! Thank you to the original creator for this wonderful recipe as well as other reviewers who suggested on omitting the olive oil because the recipe already has enough oil in it. (from the sun-dried tomatoes & Classico Pesto Sauce). I was in a hurry so l used frozen, cooked diced, chicken. It turned out so flavorful!!! I will be cooking this again & again!!!
Easy to make. Very tasty.

I give this a 3.5. I was really excited to make this for my family because of the great reviews. It was good, but my family and I did not enjoy this as much as I had hoped. After reading the other reviews, I doubled both the chicken and pesto sauce. My husband, two teenage boys, and preschooler all said it was good (when asked by me) but nobody went back for seconds. (When they love a recipe I make, they go back for seconds and compliment the dish without me asking.)
Kids loved it while my husband and I liked it. Might try to make my own pesto name to time. However the recipe as is is perfect for whipping up a quick weeknight dinner.
So simple to make. The garlic gives the chicken a wonderful flavor. I'll be using it in other meals too. The family loved it and my wife most of all.
Loved it.

Very easy! WIll make again, next time for company, perhaps. While it's not this recipe, adding artichokes, spinach or asparagus to it would be easy (once the asparagus are cooked just a little to get them to al dente when you toss all the ingredients together). Crusty bread is a must to balance the textures and compliment the tastes (but I love bread anyway)!
Made the recipe exactly as stated and found it to be a bit dry. Added more pesto, more dried tomatoes, pine nuts and a dash of Parmesan cheese which did the trick.

Super simple and tasty quick weeknight meal. Kids loved it.

A few changes:
-Used Barilla Gluten Free Rotini (holds up well)
-Double the pesto (Used pre-made Kirkland from Costco)
-Added Salt and Pepper to taste
I made this with shrimp and it was fantastic!
I added peas and it was very good. I will make this again.

I made one change to primarily enhance the appearance. I sauteed whole chicken breasts in the oil from the tomatoes. Then cut it crosswise into strips and sauteed the strips in the oil for a couple of minutes to give them a nice golden look. Then I plated it with the pasta first, a sprinkle of pine nuts, the chicken strips, and shaved parmesan on top. I served it to people from Brazil and Chile and everybody loved it! I plan to make it again for a large gathering at Christmas. It is so quick and easy.
Delicious and easy. I dont like sundried tomatoes so i put regular tomatoes. Super delish.
this was absolutely excellent! everyone loved it!
I used spiral pasta instead and sprinkled parmesan cheese on top.
I made it without crushed pepper and dried tomatoes. First time making it was delicious. I added Colby jack cheese since i didn't have parmesan. My daughter loved it.

This was excellent! I only had dry sundried tomatoes but soaked them in a bit of oil prior to throwing them in the pan with the chicken, and it came out perfectly. Even my picky kids enjoyed this meal!

This so good. The only thing added was more salt to taste and about 4 more cloves of garlic than they prescribe. It was a hit. 
This is definitely bookmarked.

Family loved this one and it is super simple to make. I added fresh tomato’s and the sun dried. I also topped with 1/2 Cup of shredded Mozzarella and 1 tablespoon of grated Parmesan. ALL loved it! Thank you for the recipe.
Add Feta
Very easy and tasty recipe!
Needed more flavor but a good first time.
Delicious, fast, easy, healthy, and inexpensive. Even my picky husband loved it. I am putting this in my regular rotation. Thanks for the great recipe!

This was so delicious and filling salad for two servings. I made very little tweaks. My generic brand of farfalle had. a cook time for 13-16 and none for el dente. So I did it past the 8-12 minutes mentioned here on the recipe. It tasted great. As for the sun-dried tomatoes, I didn't have any oil-packed, and used regular sun-dried tomatoes to cut into strips. It worked out well. I would make this again in a heartbeat.

Amazing - I tried adding pine nuts, and I also added zucchini, but I definitely think the parmesan which i don't think was listed...is a MUST - this was SOOO tasty. Too bad no one could enjoy it with me.
Delicious.
